medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain woke her from sleep at 1am on the day of presentation. It is described as throbbing that is occasionally sharp in the upper and lower abdomen, does not radiate to flank or groin, and hurts with movement. There has been no worsening in her pain. She has little appetite but denies nausea or vomiting. Reports one episode of non-bloody diarrhea on the day of presentation, with no episodes since, and last flatus yesterday.
medical_history.family_history: Family members have had 'stomach bugs', mother with diabetes mellitus, thyroid disease (possible Graves' disease), breast cancer, and adenomyosis. No history of gastrointestinal or gynecological cancers.
